answerText: Quasars  [or Quasi-stellar radio sources][10] Early galaxies, stars, and quasars re-ionized the hydrogen in this region of space at some point before redshift 6. It is composed of dust and gas that tends to clump in filaments.

question: Question: Name these elements of radio astronomy important for understanding the history of the universe, for 10 points each: [10] These significant sources of radio waves are active nuclei of distant galaxies. 3C 273 in the constellation Virgo was the first to be identified.
